revised_title: A Study of Sensitized Explosions: Ignition Phenomena in CO and O2 Mixtures Sensitized by H2
tldr: This study investigates the ignition phenomena in carbon monoxide and oxygen mixtures sensitized by hydrogen. The authors explore the role of diffusion and recombination processes in chain ending mechanisms during gas explosions. They propose an equation to determine the equilibrium concentration of free radicals in the gaseous mixture.
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Chemical kinetics and reaction dynamics
